intro: Osteospermum tridens, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and purple or white petals. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has hairy, narrow leaves. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardens and rockeries. Osteospermum tridens is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
